intro: Psoralea dietrichiae, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or pale green, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Psoralea dietrichiae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
